title.narrative: EDUCATION COVID-19 RESPONSE

description.narrative: UNICEF has technically assisted the Dominican government to respond to the emergency generated by the Covid-19 Pandemic and mobilized Dominican society to avoid contagion (Education), which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Access To Quality Learning Opportunities (Covid), Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement, Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice, Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, children will have access to high-quality, relevant, inclusive integrated care services for early childhood and education services.

Provision of (formal and non-formal) secondary education (including in temporary learning spaces, includes general and TVET)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: UNICEF has technically assisted the Dominican government to respond to the emergency generated by the Covid-19 Pandemic andmobilized Dominican society to avoid contagion (Education)

description.narrative: UNICEF support was key for the continuation of distance education and the safe reopening of schools enabling 2,200,000 students to have access to educational material for home learning.;In the first two weeks after the schools reopened,more than 2 million students received support for psycho-affective recovery with the “Return to Happiness” strategyin the 7,499 public schools nationwide.;Moreover, two accessible resource kits for students with autism and intellectual disabilities were developed. Rounds 5 and 6 of the educational booklets each had a kit with accessible pedagogical material that enabled 5,102 students with disabilities to continue learning from home. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:13/01/2022
